alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 6:48AM CST until February 06 at 9:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana...Mississippi... Tangipahoa River Near Robert affecting Tangipahoa Parish. Biloxi River Near Lyman affecting Harrison County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... West Hobolochitto Creek Near McNeill affecting Pearl River County. Wolf River Above Gulfport affecting Harrison County. For the Tangipahoa River...including Osyka, Kentwood, Amite, Robert...Minor flooding is forecast. For the West Hobolochitto Creek...including McNeill...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Wolf River...including Landon, Gulfport...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Biloxi River...including Wortham, Lyman...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Biloxi River Near Lyman. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, At 14 feet homes on lower Fisherman Trail will begin to flood and lower River Road will be impassable. Driving on Loraine Road will be hazardous due to the high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM CST this morning the stage was 12.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM CST Thursday was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to a crest of 14.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 04/14/1974. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
